intro: Macrosolen andamanensis, commonly known as the Andaman sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Andaman Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red or pink. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in coastal and moist environments, often growing near the shoreline or in humid forests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
